intro: Rauvolfia oxyphylla, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves with a distinctive yellowish-green color, and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Botanically, it belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with medicinal properties.
